page.title: 01SOUTH WEST DERBY
page.content: This is a predominantly urban area with contrasting types of housing and people from a variety of classes and cultures. In the North East lies part of the city centre which contains shops and offices and the Derbyshire Royal Infirmary.{The pattern of {housing is changing;}old inner city terraces are being demolished and replaced by modern semi-detached houses and flats many of which are for old people. At the edge of the city land is gradually being taken over for modern suburbs. Apart from a large metalworks there are only small workshops. Other important changes currently taking place are the extension of the city's hospitals and the growing number of places of worship for different religions.
